active_projects.description: Investigate and fix lean-lsp-mcp integration issues where agents do not receive or continue with tokens returned by the MCP server. Study current integration patterns and compare against best practices for MCP servers with Claude Code 2026 conventions to design systematic improvements that avoid needless complexity but enhance performance.

active_projects.description: Fix agent system interruption failures where MCP tool calls return AbortError (-32001) and agents get stuck at Interrupted prompt. Root cause analysis from /research 657 and /implement 630 failures shows: (1) lean-research-agent interrupted during lean_local_search calls, (2) lean-implementation-agent interrupted during lean_diagnostic_messages call. Both agents failed to write return metadata files, leaving tasks stuck in researching/implementing status. System improvements needed: error recovery for MCP tool failures, graceful interruption handling, partial progress preservation, and metadata file writing on timeout/abort.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive research on seed consistency proofs requiring temporal K distribution axiom with 4-phase implementation strategy
Comprehensive analysis of temporal T axiom blocking issue with complete dialectic covering four viable approaches and recommended semantic bridge solution
Analysis concluding that operator interdefinability does not provide a solution path; semantic bridge (Approach A) remains necessary
Analysis of defining reflexive G' as G ∨ φ, concluding that definitional approach does not solve seed consistency issue since G' ⊥ simplifies to G ⊥
Comprehensive analysis of axiomatizing reflexive G'/H' as primitives (Approach B/C from research-002) - VERDICT: NO-GO, 10-16 weeks effort for same result achievable in 12-17 hours via Approach A
Comprehensive pedagogical deep dive on Approach A (Semantic Bridge) with proof structure, infrastructure analysis, philosophical justification, implementation guide, and complete code templates
Comparative analysis of Approach A (Semantic Bridge) vs G' definition approaches for seed consistency - G' phi := G phi AND phi does NOT help because MCS contains G BOT, not G' BOT
Analysis of syntactic vs semantic proof concerns - semantic bridge is standard and appropriate for completeness proofs
Revised implementation plan using Approach A (Semantic Bridge)
Partial implementation - completed future_seed_consistent with new hypotheses approach

active_projects.blocked_reason: TM logic lacks temporal T axiom - cannot derive bot from G bot syntactically

active_projects.research_summary: Research completed for indexed family coherence conditions. Analyzed four coherence condition sorries (lines 433, 439, 448, 456) in IndexedMCSFamily.lean. Identified proof strategies using temporal axioms (Temporal 4, Temporal K distribution). Forward_G and backward_H are directly provable from seed construction (5-7 hours). Forward_H and backward_G require MCS negation completeness lemma (additional 4-5 hours prerequisite). Created comprehensive report with phased proof strategy, case analysis patterns, and dependency analysis.

active_projects.description: Remove the mathematically false theorem semantic_task_rel_compositionality and its sorry from SemanticCanonicalModel.lean. Research confirmed this theorem cannot be proven (unbounded duration sums exceed finite time domain), and it is not needed for the completeness proof which uses a different approach. Remove the false claim rather than accepting a sorry for an unprovable statement.

active_projects.description: Implement the .opencode system upgrade plan following specs/agent_system_upgrade_plan.md and specs/implementation_roadmap.md. This 6-week upgrade involves 4 phases: Phase 1 (Week 1): Foundation - file-based metadata exchange and state management; Phase 2 (Week 2): Workflow Ownership Migration - transfer postflight responsibilities to subagents; Phase 3 (Weeks 3-4): Meta System Builder Port - enable dynamic system extension; Phase 4 (Weeks 5-6): Forked Subagent Pattern - achieve token efficiency.

active_projects.description: Derive and prove 2 theorem groups in Logos Dynamics system based on TODO items: (1) line 200: Derive as theorem that every time in a world-history gets mapped to a world-state, then include remark discussing which constraints (from Containment subsection of counterfactual_worlds.tex line 1822) play a role in proving this theorem without assuming discreteness. Articulate theorem in Lean source with proof strategy in comments; (2) line 288: Derive Barcan formulas and prove their validity for the unrestricted quantifier and 'all possibly actual' quantifier. Similarly, show that the 'all sometimes actual' quantifier validates temporal analogs of Barcan formulas.
